Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here - its the pits”
Reviews.Author: Zaaman788
Reviews.Content: Before we even stayed there, they charged our credit card for the stay when the terms and conditions clearly stated that you do not pay until check out. Rooms were dirty and smelly, staff rude and unhelpful, free breakfast was unedible - only good thing is location (near the train) and price.

Reviews.Title: “Toilet was broken so they offered us a bucket, do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: Diandbecabroad
Reviews.Content: Location ok however rooms were terrible. Toilet was broken and we were offered a bucket!?!? Bathroom very dirty and small. Beds so uncomfortable we took the matresses off and slept on the floor with them. Some staff weren't helpful, some were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GauravCreations
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at an extremely convenient location, close to the Railway Station. We were a group of 4 friends and had booked a Quad Room for one night. We just needed a place to crash in the night and this hotel was the perfect place. The room was clean and decently furnished I would recommend this hotel, if you are planning a short stay in Rome and want easy access to the train station, or if you want to catch an early morning flight. The breakfast is served at a restaurant nearby. My trip to Rome http://www.cafeinks.com/archives/663

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviser04
Reviews.Content: For those who have a 1 night stand & need to take them somewhere....this is the place to go. Rooms stunk of smoke! My 10 year old almost threw up.. Bed covers with cigaret burns, bathroom was clean, but if you're a little large, forget it! Luckily they didn't have a room for 5 (after we booked for 5), so had to stay somewhere else. They had 4 beds in the smallest room, could hardly fit our luggage in it. Only plus... they had a lift in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Tainted our memories of Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: crassell
Reviews.Content: This Hotel only has one thing going for it...Location. The hotel reception, our room, and our breakfast place were all in completely separate buildings. Our confirmation email lead us to believe that there was free wi-fi, and all taxes were included, yet on arrival we had to pay another 4euro per night (taxes), and the Internet was 5euro a day, and was only accessible from the lobby which was in an entirely different building. However the staff did offer us a room change to get within wi-fi signal, but we opted to head over to the train station cafe to use it for free(they did great coffees). The room was large, however the bathroom was growing fungus from the shower tiles, the shower door was broken, and had a awful smell. The TV had extremely poor reception (not a big deal for us). We would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone, as there are a huge number of hotels in the same location/area so hunt around for alternatives!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HelenK13
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Planet on the basis of cost as it compared very favourably with other hotels, I read some of the reviews which seemed variable to say the least. + It is located very close to the main railway station which makes it very easy to find when getting the train from the airport + Greeting at reception was very friendly and all the staff we encountered were very helpful + Room was very clean, shower was great, towels clean and fluffy + Perfect location for exploring Rome, easy access to trains, and the bus tours of the city + Breakfast in the cafe across the road was great, it did seem a little odd to collect a ticket at reception and then trot over the road but the coffee and the pastries provided at the cafe were great and the staff there were also really welcoming - Yes, the room was small but as we only spent two nights there it was perfect, it would not have been ideal for a family but then I would not have booked it anyway. For myself and my friend it was fantastic. - The Hotel is on the 5th floor of an old building which makes for quite an odd sensation when you look down out of the window but there is a lift so access was not an issue - There was some noise on the Saturday night but not enough to disturb my nights sleep, possibly due to there being normal appartments in the same building If you are going to Rome for the weekend with a mate this Hotel is perfect and I wouldn't hesitate to recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good little basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clairev-9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before our cruise and the night we returned from the cruise. It is very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very good. If you book this hotel you may end up staying in any of the hotel group but they are all next to the station so great for getting in and out of the airport and also fantastic for the metro. We managed to get the room for 55 euro per night. Don't expect a top class hotel...this is really a B&B but the sheets are clean and the towels fluffy. Good strong coffee and simple breakfast but fresh. I would recommend this as a base for a few days stay due to location, cleanliness and price. Search about on the internet to find a good deal as the sites all vary from 55euro to 125 euro for the same dates!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep on the street. It's cheaper. Maybe cleaner.”
Reviews.Author: 407Steve
Reviews.Content: One of the worst travel experiences I have had in 40 years on the international road. The room was crowded, the furniture was junk, (one mattress fell through the springs at night, and another bed frame collapsed on my wife's foot). The Internet didn't work (@ 5 Euros per hour). The desk personnel were surly, argumentative, unhelpful, defensive and rude. Other than that, they were okay. The water pitcher in the bathroom had black mold in it. Piles of garbage in the elevator shaft, and graffiti on all the walls. I would have left if I hadn't already paid for the room, it was 11 pm and raining. We initially had reservations at the Hotel Rubino (two floors down), and our room was (inexplicably) in the Hotel Planet. Hotel Rubino looked even worse, by the way. I think they are owned by the same people. You could end up at Hotel Rubino. The "continental breakfast" was a donut ("One only!") and a coffee across the street in a bar. I would not be surprised if some of the rooms rent by the hour. Go South of the Termini and find rooms there. We found a room at the Hotel Romantica. A very nice hotel. Cheaper, clean, and the people are wonderful. But when they heard where we had been, they giggled and shook their head. Apparently, both Hotel Planet and Hotel Rubino are well known in the area. Infamous. Warn others!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but cheap and very central”
Reviews.Author: Anja_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just across the road from Termini station (which is the main train station + airport shuttles station). Very close to the main tourist attractions and for that - extremely cheap. We paid 60 euro for a double room including breakfast. The rooms are quite plain, but clean and rather quiet given the location. Bathrooms are pretty old though and so is the elevator (makes scary sounds when goes up%) ). To summarize: if you want a cheap and central place in Rome to sleep for a couple of nights, this hotel is the right choice. If you want something comfortable or romantic - skip thins one.. and prepare to pay double the price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels!”
Reviews.Author: chit1
Reviews.Content: We wanted to leave as soon as we checked in but unfortunately, we couldn't get our money back so we didn't have a choice but to stay there for 2 nights! It was the worst hotel we had stayed in. The staff were really rude (esp this Filipino lady with short hair who checked us in), the room was dirty and the toilet was small and dirty. Our room was close to the reception and it was very noisy, even late at night. We had to stay out as late as we could so we didn't have to spend much time in the room, that's how bad it was!!!! DON"T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Sachi-san
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Hotel Planet in a pinch, and we got out as soon as we could the next morning! Our room was near the main reception desk, so that accounted for the ridiculous noise level all night long. But since the rooms are all crowded on one floor, I assume they're all quite loud. Far worse, though (as the other reviews mention), was that the bathroom was not clean. I actually wiped up the floor myself when we arrived. Besides that, the furniture was all chipped. We were surprised that this hotel even qualifies for 2 stars. You can certainly find better places in the hotel-laden area around the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: -champagne1_
Reviews.Content: 3 words - "Don't stay here" It was a 2 star so I don't know what I expected. Breakfast was across the road in a crowded busy bar which consisted of 1 cup of coffee and a pastry. Shower room was okay if you were a short midget. Bedding was clean but had cigarette holes in sheets and top cover. Noisy at night. Only good thing was it was near the Termini Stazione as I was travelling around and was near the Roma sightseeing buses outside the station. Other than that a bit of a dodgy area at night. Take your own towels and toiletries if you do decide to stay here and also it's 5 flights up - ugh not good after trekking around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I cried when I got there”
Reviews.Author: dearbronx
Reviews.Content: I dreamed about going to Rome since I was little and this hotel made me want to go home the day I finally got there. We (my grandma, a cousin and I) booked our stay some months in advance, mostly because it was a cheap hotel near the Termini, a railway/subway station. We weren't expecting something amazing, but at least clean a comfortable. When we got there we were shocked. The hotel is located in a extremely dangerous street and I'd not recommend walking there after 8h00 pm. The reception was not great. The receptionist was arguing with some hosts and there was no sofas for us to wait. After almost 30 minutes waiting we were able to go to our room, that was so disgusting we were afraid of walking barefoot. The bathroom was a nightmare! Dirty, Dark. I had to ask more then twice to get my mattress (which had a whole) changed, the wardrobe was so full of dust we did not touch it. Pay a bit more and stay somewhere decent! DO NOT STAY THERE. Get a hotel anywhere far away from the Termini surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest People in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: myst7
Reviews.Content: When i was at the train station in rome ready to go to the airport I phone back to the hotel Planet to see if my battery and battery charger was in the room I was going to run back and get it, i was told no it was not there. When i got to the airport I checked in my luggage and it was not there so i phoned back to the Hote Planet and the staff lady who answered the phone said that she was glad the i contacted her because she had found my property and that the nite staff and taken it out of the room and put it away so she told me to send and email with my home address and my property (battery and battery charger) would be retuned. WELL all i have had back from them is that it is not there so someone there is a theif or they are just plain liars I WOULD NOT RECOMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE AS I HAVE FOUND THEM TO BE TOTALLY DISHONEST

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel, awful management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The website and the photos of the Hotel Planet greatly misrepresent the dirty, unsanitary and unwelcoming reality of the establishment. The structure of the hotel is uncoordinated and inefficient making it necessary for one to travel to the 5th floor of the building to check in then back to the 2nd floor to the rooms. With luggage and no help from the staff this introduction sets the scence for the truely awful experience that staying at the Hotel Planet is. The official website photos present spacious, fesh and welcoming rooms-in fact they are tiny, overpriced and quite frankly grotty. Upon our arrival to the hotel my boyfriend and I were greeted by insects in our room and our obvious concerns were ignored by staff memebers. I can only describe the lady that "greeted" us as quite typical of the Hotel Planet's staff- unfriendly, rude, disinterested and of appaling attitude for those in the hospitality business. In most parts of the world a small glass of juice and a croissant does not constitute as breakfast however that is what is offered here. Also, one should point out breakfast is not in the hotel but in an independent cafe. WARNING JUST DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The people who run Hotel Planet and its various sister properties engage in deceptive practices. We paid in advance for three nights and after being shifted from one room already - a shoebox with a filthy bath, broken beds and a lousy view - we were advised that a mistake had been made and the third night was not available anymore, even though we had already paid for it. They were miffed we wanted our money back as only a complacent operator can be. The folks at the Termini hotel desk noted this is not an isolated problem with this bunch as they have been known to give the room to a booking agency who can get a higher rate and those on their own have to fend for themselves. I have been traveling in Italy a wonderful country for more than 20 years and have seen a lot of shady operators but never one so boldly unscrupulous as the Hotel Planet. Don't waste your time or your money.

Reviews.Title: “Simply terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please, do not go to this Hotel. I went to Rome with some friends. We had a look at the Hotel Planet web site and it appeared to be a quite pleasant little hotel. We booked two double rooms in advance (price, EUR 100/night). When we arrived, we noticed that the Hotel is terrible. It is placed in the 5th Floor of a noisy, old and dirty building. Staff of the hotel is really rude. The rooms are dirty and the baths have the size of a matchs box. Incredible! Please do not trust the web site. We refused to stay at this Hotel and we had to look for another one. Although we did not stay at the rooms, Hotel Planet requested us to pay EUR 200 and, since we refused to do it, they charged this amount in our credit card. This Hotel is like a nightmare. If you want to enjoy your stay in Rome, please choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite happy at Hotel Planet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Planet in Rome for 4 nights in November. We arrived in the evening and the staff were charming to us. The 2 of us managed to fit into the lift with our suitcases without a problem. Yes it was small but who worries about the lift! Our room was clean, there was lots of hot water and the room was tidied every day. We were told that there was a discount for cash so we took up that option. We were not hassled to pay and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. It was in a good location for sightseeing. We were careful around the station at night but you get that anywhere. If you want a cheap hotel in central Rome then I would suggest you stay here. If you want something flash, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Like in a jail !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Date = April 2005 This hotel was simply a nightmare for our stay in Rome. I was with friends, we are young and not particulary hard to please. But too much is too much... Rooms are very small, noisy and really dirty. Air conditionned was not working in our room (and nobody knows why). This place is not well organized and people working there not friendly at all. I think they just don't care about tourists. The breakfast was composed by a simple cup of coffee (in fact this was a warm liquid... I hope it was coffee) and a single bread piece with butter and jam. It looked like a jail breakfast (and you have to call at least twice the reception to obtain it). I think that for this price we had deserved much more better. This hotel is just a shame and please never go there. Last funny think: you are charged 10Euros/day if you pay by Credit Card! We were not informed about it when booking. Otherwise Rome is a nice city and I hope I will go there again. Cheers and enjoy your stay in Rome, but avoid those ugly low cost ** hotels close to Termini railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bad hotel, pure and simple. We reserved a single room for 2 adults, but were initially put in a family room (all this meant was that there was an extra bed in the room). We then had to pack up and move after the first night, and were put in a double room that was about as noisy as it gets. Amazingly, the staff told us that this 2nd room was much quieter than our first... To top it off, they tried to stick us with a 40 Euro charge upon checking out, to pay the difference for not staying in a single room. We refused to pay, since we booked a single and it was not up to us what room we were put in. Rooms were dirty, the lift is the size of a small shower, and its on the 5th floor. The only redeeming quality of this place is its proximity to the train station. Stay away, trust me.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is terrible! Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were extremely rude and unfriendly. The rooms were not very clean, my mattress sloped sideways, the bathroom fittings were broken (including shower head, plug in the basin, and pipe fittings). The toilet didn't flush properly. And, it was extremely noisy - from both the street outside and the reception area. It is extremely close to the Station Termini, but the area is not a good one, you should be extremely careful walking back at night. The street was filthy and littered with broken glass. The room did include breakfast which was delivered to you room. You were required to call the reception to order whichever hot drink you wanted. Breakfast consisted of the hot drink, one bread roll, one pack of butter, and one pack of jam - per person. We were obliged to stay 2 nights as we had made our reservation in advance, however we found another hotel for the remaining nights. In the same price range, near San Pietro (extremely well-serviced by metro and bus lines) and a completely different class of hotel! (after staying at Hotel Planet we felt like our new hotel was 5* (although it was also rated as 2*). As an additional warning - this is part of a group that appears to operate at least 3 hotels in Rome - we understood them to all be at the same standard. Hotel Blu is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful place, avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: mairidh
Reviews.Content: Dreadful place. Be aware, the hotel is on the 5th floor with a rickety lift. We were promised a 1st floor room as I don't use lifts and their email confirmed this but they offered us a 5th floor room on arrival and, being no spring chicken, I wasn't prepared to go up 5 flights of stairs. Anyway, from what my husband told me when he returned to the lobby after checking in, I wouldn't have been comfortable on the 5th floor as there appeared to be no fire escape etc. They refused to refund us our money. Please, please don't stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Planet Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Milazzo 3, 00185 Rome, Italy
